item.title: Roblox: Blox Fruits Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Blox Fruits Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Blox Fruits
  • How to Play Blox Fruits
  • The Best Roblox Adventure Games Like Blox Fruits

Summary

  • Roblox players can redeem Blox Fruits codes to get in-game rewards like double XP and free stat resets.
  • New Blox Fruits codes are rare these days, but there are still plenty of working codes available for new players.
  • All of the Blox Fruits codes listed below are checked regularly to make sure that they're still active.

When it comes to Roblox games that were inspired by fan-favorite anime series, they don't come much bigger than Blox Fruits . It regularly has more than three-quarters of a million active players and has racked up more than 33 billion visits since its launch in early 2019. It's a must-play for anyone craving a life of adventure, particularly those who also happen to enjoy games like One Piece ​​​​​​.

Much of the game's success can be attributed to the tireless work of the developers, who are constantly adding innovative new features and mechanics for Roblox players to enjoy. They also release new Blox Fruits codes from time to time, which fans of the game can redeem to receive XP boosts, stat resets, and a bunch of other fantastic in-game goodies.

Updated September 2, 2025, by Tom Bowen: After months of waiting, a new Blox Fruits code has finally arrived. For the next seven days, players can use the code LIGHTNINGABUSE to get twenty minutes of double XP. To avoid missing out on potential double XP and Stat Reset codes, they should then take a few moments to bookmark this page so that they can check back here often, as we're constantly on the lookout for new codes for Blox Fruits and will update the table below with any that we find.

Expired Blox Fruit Codes

  • ADMIN_STRENGTH – Redeem for 2x Experience
  • DRAGONABUSE – Redeem for 2x Experience

  • STAFFBATTLE – Redeem for 2x Experience
  • JULYUPDATE_RESET – Redeem for Stat Reset

How to Redeem Codes for Blox Fruits

When it comes to redeeming codes for Blox Fruit , there are a few simple steps to follow that will be listed below. If, for some reason, a code does not work, players should be sure to check to see if the code has been entered correctly . If the code still doesn't work, this may mean that it has recently expired or has already been redeemed.

  1. Launch Blox Fruits.
  2. Click on the blue and white gift icon on the left side of the screen.
  3. Enter a code from our list of active Blox Fruits codes.
  4. Press the Redeem! button.

How to Play Blox Fruits

First, players must choose either the Marines or Pirates faction. Then, players have to take quests to get XP and Beli, the local currency. For Beli, players can buy swords, guns, Blox Fruits that give skills, and, most importantly, boats. With these boats, players can travel to other islands and find the best vendors and strong bosses. Also, starting from level 20, players can engage in PvP between factions.

The Best Roblox Adventure Games Like Blox Fruits

Playing the same game can often get a little boring, leaving some players craving something new. For those who find themselves in that position, these popular Roblox games like Blox Fruits should definitely help to scratch that itch:

  • Anime Roulette
  • Your Bizarre Adventure
  • Dragon Adventures
  • A One Piece Game
  • Anime Souls Simulator

item.title: No Man's Sky Testing New Experimental Branch Update
item.description:
No Man’s Sky released a new experimental branch on September 1, addressing various issues players have encountered in the game. Hello Games occasionally rolls out experimental branch updates for No Man’s Sky players on Steam to test, and this latest one should improve the gameplay experience.

This latest experimental branch patch comes shortly after Hello Games released the Voyagers update for No Man’s Sky . Bringing customizable Corvette-class starships to the game, Voyagers added lots more new content for players to check out. However, it also introduced some new bugs that the development team has been working to squash.

The new experimental branch update for September 1 is Hello Games' latest effort to fix issues players have encountered as a result of the new content. According to the patch notes, numerous issues with Corvette-class starships have been addressed. Additionally, Corvette parts can now be stacked to 50, and the workshop cache capacity has been increased to 160. Other various fixes were implemented, and several crashing issues were resolved.

While these numerous changes will likely be introduced to the base game in the future, this experimental branch is currently limited to PC players on Steam. To test out the latest changes, players have to navigate to their Steam library page and right-click on the No Man’s Sky icon. They can then select “Properties,” which grants access to the “BETAS” tab. From there, players can enter "3xperimental" in the text field and click “Check Code” to bring up the experimental branch. It is worth noting that Hello Games recommends that players back up their save files on PC before entering the experimental branch. Fortunately, the developer provided an in-depth explanation in a Steam post for those unsure how to do so.

These new improvements should make the game even better for its many players. However, Hello Games encouraged testers to report any issues they encountered in the experimental branch. It is worth noting that the game has recently seen a surge in popularity. Thanks to the Voyagers update, No Man’s Sky ’s popularity has spiked. Following the launch of the update, the game exceeded 90,000 concurrent players, the highest total since its 2016 launch.

It will be interesting to see what the future holds for No Man’s Sky . While Hello Games continues to work on Light No Fire , the recent Voyagers update suggests that much more for the 2016 game could be in the works. In the meantime, players seemingly have lots to check out in the space-faring game.

No Man's Sky Experimental Branch September 2 - Patch Notes

  • Fixed an issue which caused players to clip through the walls of a corvette.
  • Fixed an issue which caused players to slide as they got out of the pilot's seat in a corvette.
  • Fixed a rare issue that could cause players to be jettisoned out their corvette when activating the pulse drive.
  • Fixed an issue that could caused corvette technologies to be placed in the inventory of regular ships.
  • Improved camera framing when exiting the pilot's seat of a corvette.
  • Fixed a large number of issues with corvette ramp/door synchronisation.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from teleporting back to their corvette after a save/load aboard a freighter.
  • Players can now manually summon their corvettes while aboard a freighter.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented corvettes from docking with some pirate and abandoned stations.
  • Fixed an issue which caused players to sink into seats aboard corvettes.
  • Fixed an issue which caused sliding on corvette ramps.
  • Fixed an issue that could cause group member's freighters to despawn after boarding in a corvette.
  • Fixed an issue that could prevent players from sitting on chairs in a moving corvette.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from summoning a corvette over water.
  • Fixed two specific corvette parts that would not stack / could not be spent after rotating.
  • Fixed an issue with Thunderbird Landing Thrusters animations.
  • Fixed an issue which caused the Azimuth Reactor to be uninteractible once placed.
  • Corvette parts can now be manually placed in the Corvette Workshop Cache.
  • Corvette workshop cache capacity has been increased to 160.
  • Corvette parts now stack up to 50.
  • Fixed a rare issue that prevented players from deleting some items once added to a corvette.
  • Improved the visuals of the thunderbird-class landing thrusters.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from teleporting aboard a corvette with a thunderbird-style accessway.
  • Fixed an issue with multi input refiners.
  • Fixed an issue which prevented Humming Sacs and Fiend Eggs from being collected.
  • Fixed an issue which resulted in invisible blocking physics in freighter bases.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented players from summoning secondary ships on planets, if those ships were in a high-numbered ship slot.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented settlement sentinel and infestation attacks from ever occurring.
  • Fixed a number of collision issues in abandoned and pirate space stations.
  • Added an animation to Skyborn backpack.
  • Fixed an issue which caused warp audio not to play.
  • Fixed a number of audio issues aboard a corvette with its pulse drive active.
  • Improved space walking in VR.
  • Fixed a large number of control issues in VR.
  • Fixed a number of issues with markers and labels while spacewalking in VR.
  • Fixed a number of issues with corvette cockpits in VR.
  • Various corvette asset optimisations.
  • Introduced a significant memory optimisation for Xbox.
  • Fixed a crash while using a pulse drive.
  • Fixed a number of networking-related crashes.
  • Fixed a crash related to summoning your freighter.
  • Fixed a crash related to AI spaceships.
  • Fixed an experimental-branch only hang that could occur when summoning a freighter.

PHYSICAL

Lose yourself in a vast sci-fi odyssey as you explore a near-infinite, procedurally generated universe. Set out from the edge of the Euclid galaxy and carve out your own interstellar existence in a vast universe teeming with life, danger and near-endless mystery. No Man's Sky is a hugely-ambitious, heavily-stylised, sci-fi adventure that spans entire galaxies all brought to life with procedural generation. Travel through an endless array of increasingly diverse and dangerous star systems, prospecting for rare materials, trading with alien life, populate planets and searching for clues to the meaning of the universe's mysterious existence. How you survive is up to you. Assemble entire fleets of dreadnought-class freighters and tear across the universe; build sprawling habitable bases across planet surfaces, beneath the ground or under the ocean; buy and upgrade your own weapons and star ships and do battle with outlaw space pirates, hostile alien fauna or the mysterious sentinel fleets. The universe is yours to explore - trillions upon trillions of planets, waiting to be discovered.

item.title: If Kingdom Hearts 4’s World Leak is True, Square Enix is Leaving One Massive Box Unchecked
item.description:
One of the most thrilling aspects of any Kingdom Hearts game is the crossovers it features with multiple worlds players traverse to interact with iconic characters from beloved franchises. Kingdom Hearts worlds include Winnie-the-Pooh ’s 100 Acre Wood , Hercules ’ Olympus, Monsters, Inc. ’s Monstropolis, and the Toy Story -inspired Toy Box, among others. Between Disney and Square Enix, this collaboration has proven incredibly fruitful. It will now be fascinating to see which worlds all make the cut in Kingdom Hearts 4 , with the real-life Tokyo-inspired hub world of Quadratum confirmed and many other worlds supposedly leaked recently.

Any and all leaks should be taken with copious amounts of salt. But, if legitimate, what doesn’t appear in this leaked list from an alleged Square Enix “insider” and originally reported by Vice is as interesting as what does. Excluded from the likes of The Incredibles , Wreck-It Ralph , and Zootopia , there’s one indomitable heavy-hitter that Kingdom Hearts 4 perhaps either couldn’t include, didn’t want to include, or decided to preserve, while another equally immense Disney franchise possibly steals the show.

Marvel Could Be Kingdom Hearts 4’s Biggest Flex, But It Doesn’t Seem Likely

Quite notably, Marvel is nowhere to be seen in the long laundry list of leaked Kingdom Hearts 4 worlds. Nothing has suggested that Marvel will have a world in Kingdom Hearts 4 , to be fair, but it doesn’t seem like it’d necessarily be out of the realm of possibility with nearly every other Disney property being on the table. Assuming that the leaked list is correct, there are at least a couple of valid reasons why Kingdom Hearts 4 may not have a Marvel world:

  • Marvel, and particularly the MCU, is an enormous franchise and may be one of the few that can overshadow all other Disney crossover worlds around it. In this case, Kingdom Hearts 4 avoiding Marvel may be in its best interests so that other worlds have their time in the sun.
  • The MCU isn’t nearly as ubiquitously adored today as it was a decade ago, with many polarizing and divisive entries, which would make it a rather tough pill to swallow regarding the cameos of some characters if the MCU was chosen as the Marvel adaptation Kingdom Hearts 4 would feature and not simply the Marvel comic book universe more generally.
  • Perhaps Square Enix wishes to explore Marvel with undivided attention in Kingdom Hearts 5 , where it’d maybe be able to wield it as a centerpiece.

Kingdom Hearts 4 could undoubtedly be molded into a Marvel Easter egg celebration where ravenous Marvel fans are suddenly flooding into a Square Enix series they know little to nothing about, and thus shying away from something that colossal might be in its favor. Rather, with Star Wars both potentially teased in an official capacity and making it onto this leaked list, the argument that Marvel could be too big a franchise to include may hold no weight.

Kingdom Hearts 4 Doesn’t Need to Get Greedy if It Already Boasts Star Wars

A Star Wars world hasn’t been outright confirmed for Kingdom Hearts 4 . However, Kingdom Hearts 4 ’s 2022 announcement trailer may have teased a Star Wars world, or at least seems to have, with one enigmatic glimpse of a forest that looks strikingly like Star Wars ’ forest moon, Endor.

Therefore, Star Wars is perhaps the safest bet to actually be featured in-game out of the list’s leaks. Kingdom Hearts 4 may not be large enough to harbor both Star Wars and Marvel, Disney’s two biggest titans, though.

Having Star Wars and Marvel would be fascinating from the perspective of a Disney fan, as they potentially get to interact with Yoda in one world and then Spider-Man in another, but the Disney side would arguably eclipse anything Square Enix or Kingdom Hearts -related as a result.

It might make more sense to give Marvel its world in a future Kingdom Hearts game, so that it isn’t competing for players’ curiosity against Star Wars . Regardless, neither Star Wars nor Marvel has been confirmed, whether that’s a confirmation of it being featured or not, and it’ll likely be some time still before it’s discovered if the leaked list of worlds is accurate.

item.title: YouTuber Law By Mike is Suing Roblox
item.description:
YouTuber and real-life lawyer Law By Mike has announced plans to sue Roblox over an alleged failure to properly protect children on its platform. Controversy is nothing new for the game, but it's come under particular scrutiny in recent months amid a wave of lawsuits and public outcry against company leadership. Now, yet another party has joined the growing action against Roblox and its moderation policies.

Things have not been easy for the Roblox Corporation lately. Over 120,000 people have signed a petition for Roblox to remove its CEO, and the State of Louisiana opened a lawsuit against the company in mid-August, claiming it has not done enough to ensure the safety of underage users. The case is still ongoing, and Roblox has still performed remarkably well despite the controversy, but action against the platform keeps growing.

Lawyer and YouTuber Law By Mike Is Joining a Case Against Roblox

In a September 1 video, Law By Mike announced he was working with the legal team of another YouTuber, Schlep, to sue Roblox . While Schlep has not filed a lawsuit yet, Law By Mike and the other lawyers are currently raising awareness about the game's alleged child safety issues and have suggested that formal legal action is incoming. The movement comes after multiple allegations that a lack of moderation makes it easy for criminals to talk to and potentially take advantage of minors on the platform. It brings to mind another lawsuit against Roblox over a 13-year-old girl's kidnapping, and Law By Mike has encouraged anyone who has gone through similar experiences to reach out to his firm.

In the face of the rising legal action and negative press, the Roblox Corporation has asserted that its recent reputation does not accurately reflect its commitment to child safety. After the Louisiana Attorney General filed a lawsuit, Roblox pointed to 40 new tools to protect children that it has implemented over the past year. These include chat filters, more extensive parental controls, and limits on direct messages for users under 13. At the same time, Law By Mike's video claims Roblox is not as secure as it has said it is.

In addition to the protections mentioned in its response to the Louisiana lawsuit, Roblox has announced changes to its adult content policies in the past week. The game is raising the age requirement for viewing restricted content as well as reducing the visibility of such experiences to underage users. It's unclear how the platform's ongoing legal challenges will proceed from here, though for now, Roblox is still seeing impressive player counts.

item.title: Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest (Isaac's Lost Item) In Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar
item.description:
Villager quests in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar are not only required to unlock the locked Friendship level, but the mission will also come with various rewards, like Friendship Points, recipes, or other items. Among the available quests, the ones from Isaac are top priority as they're the ones that will unlock the Zephyr Town Windmills. For that, here's how players can find Isaac's lost item in SoS GB to quickly complete the Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar .

Isaac's Lost Item Location In SoS GB - Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

Isaac's lost item in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar is located on the left side of the bazaar area ​​​​​. After reaching the bazaar, turn left and head up the stairs. Then, move south to another set of stairs, and walk along the fence to find two benches. There will be a glowing spot near one of the bazaar benches, which players can Check to obtain Isaac's lost item in SoS GB .

How To Trigger The Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest In SoS GB - Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar is given by Isaac, the husband of Nadine, and the father of Sylvia and Laurie. To trigger the Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest, players must progress with the bazaar until the town reaches the Town Bazaar rank (level 3). Then, there should be a blue exclamation mark next to Isaac's picture on the map. Speak with Isaac to begin the Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest in SoS GB .

Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest Reward In SoS GB - Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

The reward for finding Isaac's lost item in the Seen Anything Lying Around? Quest in SoS GB is the Blue Windmill . This will be the second Windmill unlocked in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar , after the initial Red Windmill. After this, only the Yellow Windmill is left to unlock. However, unlocking the Windmills won't be the end of the players' journey with crafting, as later, they must also obtain Wonderstones to get more out of these Windmills.

Players will also earn Friendship Points in SoS GB with Isaac for completing this quest. The three Windmill quests will basically put Isaac's Friendship ahead of most other villagers in town, since players should prioritize them to gain access to more Windmill items.
